desc: Butterfly Books create career themed picture books promoting diversity.There are currently 3 titles:•	My Mummy is an Engineer (ISBN-13: 978-0993276903)•	My Mummy is a Plumber (ISBN-13: 978-0993276927)•	My Mummy is a Scientist (ISBN-13: 978-0993276941)Due to national skills gaps in certain careers there is currently a lot of focus within educational establishments to encourage diversity within fields such as STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering and Mathematics).The books are aimed at readers aged 3 to 7 years old with target buyers being educational establishments including pre-schools and primary schools.The butterfly is a symbol of transformation and Butterfly Books hopes to transform the way in which youngsters perceive various careers. In addition, The Butterfly Effect refers to the theory whereby a minute localised change in a complex system can have large affects elsewhere and this is the hope of Butterfly books.We would like to create a trailer / video advertising our company and books, this can be animated / a video or a mixture of both.
title: Trailer / video creator for our self-publishing company

desc: I started War of Awards in 2015 with a small crowd at the LA Cosplay Con during E3.  The concept of War of Awards is essentially debates about what will/should win awards.  I kept it on track but had to hire a camera person who did not really deliver the style I asked.To make sure I got the right style of camera work, I shot it myself with a small rig in 2016 at PAX South in San Antonio:[url removed, login to view]But being absent as host meant it went off the rails in places, and regrettably I did not switch to picture mode occasionally to get very high resolution crowd shots for marketing/web purposes.So my main goal for the next event in Denver is to get those pictures if we have a decent crowd, but also find someone who can match the orbital video style and demonstrate it beforehand with a test run that I will suggest and describe.I'll be hosting and working the crowds again, curious to see how the esports community responds.The venue is National Western Complex where they are having the Dreamhack show.  Because this is the first year of the show, I'm not sure what to expect and am hesitant to invest in a full crew.  I'm hoping to get the right person who is a jack of all trades and come away with solid pics and b-roll, then possibly go bigger next year with full sponsorship.I think we are scheduled for 4:30pm on October 21.  Still confirming time.
title: Photography/Videography at Dreamhack

desc: I need someone to take a look at the animation and let me know if you can make the changes that I need? The first animation labelled "HomePage Rolling"...#1 - The top of the page animation should stop moving and remain stable after it plays just once leaving the main logo (car outline with "Start") still. The gear behind the cartoon mechanic rotates until the upper logo animation finishes playing then both the gear and the logo remain stable/still while the rolling information bar begins to "roll" with 5 second pause/intervals between each heading (Location, hours, etc.). Please look at the video animation attached.#2 - At the same time the information bar rolls I wanted the lower bar (with phone number) to roll at the same time. I want the lower bar (where the phone number is placed) to look and roll the same as the upper information bar. The lower bar should rotate "Phone - 604-467-2944", "Fax - 604-467-2936" and E-Mail - "startauto(the "at" symbol)[url removed, login to view]" at the same hold rate of 5 seconds only the lower should rotate Phone, Fax, Phone, e-mail, Phone, etc.#3 - I want the lower rolling bar & the upper rolling bar to be the exact color, font & size - all sizing to be equal please. I wanted all colors to be exactly the same. I have 2 shades of grey and 1 blue color using a white background - please look at the color information again that I have attached.#4 - the background is using photos of my shop that have been "photo-shopped". I would prefer to use the picture labelled "Start 3" (to use as the background behind the cartoon mechanic).The last thing I want to add is that I am changing website host from "Yellow Pages" to "HostPapa". You will be able to check out HostPapa to see what format will work with their site. If you have any problems with these "needs" of mine please let me know. Eventually I will want to use video & whiteboard animation to describe (expand on) each of my information pages (Location, Services, Etc.). I have a cartoon Truck & Car that I want to used as a transition between information pages. I want to have this homepage completed first & I hope that you can help me with that? I am also very interested in hearing any input that you have weather it is artistic or functional - let me know what you think!Tim from Start Auto
title: Complete a partially finished website & get it ready to go live

desc: We work with the creation of videos for families by using the video editor Pinnacle Studio 18.The task we need is very simple.You will receive a link with the photos (100-300 photos)We will give you a effects plugin that you need to install to your pinnacle studio 18.The effects come in a list numbered from 100 to 300.The job consists of adding the photos, then adding the effects and then adding the music we will provide you.We recommend you only bid if you have a good computer. This job is very easy and each video might take 30 to 35 minutes to conclude if you have a good computer. If your computer is slow you will have a very hard time and the job might take you from 1 hour to 1h30m.If you have enough RAM memory and the most important, a fast HD (the job requires opening and closing the effects plugin so the HD is what makes it open fast or slow) you could make the job in a smaller time.The payment for each video is 7$.You might start slowly but then we might give you 3 to 5 videos to work on at once.This is a long term project - We are looking for people that can work with us for 4 months to a year.To work in this project you need to have pinnacle studio 18 or get it.----------------------------------In summary:-Download the photos-Add the photos, effects and music-Send the video back to us
title: Creating videos by using Pinnacle Studio 18 - (Long Term)

desc: I'm a hobbyist working on a feature 3D animation using Poser and some other programs. The film takes place primarily on an alien planet that has a lot of sci-fi architecture mixed with natural elements. I'm looking to get about 10 animated shots and 5 still images. These will consist of a detailed 3D alien landscape with a fantasy-like feel. There is a section where I would need a crowd of people and moving elements like birds e.t.c mixed in, it isn't a requirement but a nice bonus if you are able to include these as well. I'm looking for someone who has experience in programs like e-on Vue. If you create great landscapes in other programs, that is okay too. I don't have a preference on the tool you use. I'm also not looking for ultra realism. This isn't Pixar. I'm one person trying to make a feature 3D animation, it can be a little rudimentary, but not completely cartoony. A lot of the shots I need will be following a tram on a monorail throughout the landscape with some caves, waterfalls, arches, rivers, buildings, castles, towers, e.t.cDepending on what program you use, I may be able to do the animation and renderings myself if provided the project files. If not, I will need these rendered out in full quality. I can provide some pre-visualization of each shot so you get a sense of what is needed.Thank you!
title: The Exigency - Feature animation

title: Web development

desc: 1.	find 3D head pose estimation of stereo video2.	use facial model  applied to both the left and right image frames, so that a set of 49 landmark points of the face are detected and tracked on both image3.	compute 3D points lead to 3 D head pose computation4.	write all steps you have done among with results and discussion5.	I will share the video data with you .note : video was recorded on ZED stereo camera with extension SVOits going to be two milestone : first one to deliver result and report , second one to release code and address comments if there is a comment
title: 3D Head pose Estimation_2 -- 4
